title: How to Keep Eyeliner on Your Waterline All Day

steps.title: Curl your eyelashes to stop them from touching your waterline.
steps.content: Curl your eyelashes to stop them from touching your waterline. If you have long lashes or they tend to stick straight downward, they might be rubbing against your upper waterline and smudging your makeup. Hold an eyelash curler up to your eyelashes and gently close the curler around them. Hold the curler shut for about 30 seconds and then gently open up the curler before you take it away from your eye. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Dab concealer underneath your eyes.
steps.content: Dab concealer underneath your eyes. Use the concealer that you usually use for your undereyes and apply a small amount beneath your eyes with your fingers. This will help your makeup stay in place longer and move around less on your face. [2] X Research source Do not put concealer in your actual waterline. This will irritate your eyes.

steps.title: Sharpen your eyeliner pencil before you use it.
steps.content: Sharpen your eyeliner pencil before you use it. Sharpening your eyeliner is good practice to get rid of bacteria, but it also makes the eyeliner more pigmented and easier to apply. Make sure your eyeliner pencil is sharp before you put it on your waterline. [3] X Research source You can use a normal pencil sharpener on your eyeliner pencil. Once you've sharpened your eyeliner pencil, be sure to be extra gentle when applying your eyeliner. [4] X Expert Source Melissa Jannes Beauty Stylist Expert Interview. 30 August 2019.

steps.title: Dry your waterline with a cotton swab.
steps.content: Dry your waterline with a cotton swab. Take a cotton swab and carefully swipe it along your upper and lower waterline. Try to absorb as much of the liquid on your waterline as you can. Use caution so that you don’t poke your actual eyeball. [5] X Research source It can be hard to swipe your upper waterline with a cotton swab. You can skip your upper one if it is too difficult for you. If you have sensitive eyes or wear contact lenses, you may want to skip this step.

steps.title: Use a waterproof eyeliner pencil on your waterline.
steps.content: Use a waterproof eyeliner pencil on your waterline. Your waterline is constantly coming into contact with the liquid from your eyeballs. Put a waterproof eyeliner on your upper and lower waterline to prevent the liquid from breaking it down throughout the day. [6] X Research source Use caution if you are applying eyeliner to your upper waterline so that you don’t hurt your eyeball. [7] X Expert Source Melissa Jannes Beauty Stylist Expert Interview. 30 August 2019. If your eye starts to water as you are applying your liner, it may never set. Wait for your eye to dry and then reapply the liner.

steps.title: Press a gel eyeliner on top of the waterproof eyeliner.
steps.content: Press a gel eyeliner on top of the waterproof eyeliner. Gel eyeliner isn’t specifically marketed as waterproof, but it helps to lock in the pencil eyeliner and add more depth of color to your waterline. Use an angled makeup brush to apply the gel eyeliner on top of the pencil eyeliner on your upper and lower waterline. [8] X Research source Gel eyeliner stays on longer and doesn’t smear as much as pencil eyeliner.

steps.title: Pat eyeshadow on top of your liner with an angled brush.
steps.content: Pat eyeshadow on top of your liner with an angled brush. Choose an eyeshadow color that closely matches the color of your eyeliner. Pick up some eyeshadow with an angled brush and gently pat it onto your upper and lower waterline. [9] X Research source Powder helps to set the eyeliner and make it even more waterproof.

steps.title: Clean up any smudges with a cotton swab.
steps.content: Clean up any smudges with a cotton swab. You may have gotten some eyeliner or eyeshadow underneath of your eyes, or the products may be starting to fall off of your waterline. Clean up around your eyes with a cotton swab to make your waterline look cleaner. [10] X Research source Dip your cotton swab in a small amount of makeup remover if you need to.

steps.title: Avoid touching or rubbing your eyes throughout the day.
steps.content: Avoid touching or rubbing your eyes throughout the day. Making your eyes water increases the chances that your eyeliner will start to smudge or come off. Try not to touch your eyes or your makeup as you keep your liner on all day. [11] X Research source
